description: lee (“side away from the wind”) +‎ way

entries.meaning: The drift of a ship or aeroplane in a leeward direction.
A varying degree or amount of freedom or flexibility.
examples: Synonyms: freedom, flexibility, latitude, margin, wiggle room, elbowroom
I don't think we have a lot of leeway when it comes to proper formatting.

entries.meaning: (Britain) An adverse discrepancy or variation in a cumulative process, usually in the phrase make up leeway.
